website_summaries.verdict: The Sense Link is a cool-looking Salomon running shoe that’s great for tempo training over soft trails. It has some supportive mechanics that keep the foot more balanced for better performance.
pros: Quick-drying Open Mesh makes up the upper unit of the Sense Link
The Sensifit overlays offer a more secure fit while the Endofit features a sock-like interior construction
Injected EVA is the midsole cushioning component of this shoe, which brings plush underfoot support based on the comments of some runners
Most runners appreciated the Contagrip outsole, which provides reliable traction over various terrains
The low-cut design and non-prominent outsole design brings freedom of movement and the capability to function on roads
cons: The upper material easily broke down for some testers
Others noted that the mid-sole unit wasn’t very efficient in its cushioning purpose

customer_reviews.title: Stiff and a bit narrow.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a pair of green running shoes, since I had other colors. These are a bit tight (I wear 14-D). Also the heel ridge and edge around the shoe opening is very stiff and uncomfortable. I'm hoping it breaks in with more wear, but we'll see. Right now, I'm not wearing them much, after the first day.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Moore

customer_reviews.title: Great deal, good running shoe.
customer_reviews.text: Good toe box. A little tight in the arch instep. Nice inner lining. Great heal adjustment for a narrow heal. Granny green is wow. Over all a nice shoe. I'm ready to see how long they will endure.
customer_reviews.author: James Barnett

customer_reviews.title: Well built shoe which perfroms well
customer_reviews.text: Well built shoe which performs well. Excellent cushion and flex. I have many Salomon shoes and boots, so I felt comfortable with how the brand fits in general. This particular shoe fit slightly smaller than expected, however. Always a bit of a gamble buying on-line in this regard, but I know that Amazon and the seller stand behind the products that they sell and that was helpful.
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe but get a half size bigger than normal!
customer_reviews.text: After reading the reviews, when I ordered my pair, I went up half a size and they are a perfect fit! Within 10 minutes of walking the slightly tightness gave in and my feet felt wonderfully supported. As for running, they are very light but you get a good cushion. Highly recommended, but do get half a size bigger than you would normally. At first I wasn't too sure on the lurid green colour but they have really grown on me!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my uses
customer_reviews.text: Use it for riding my mountain bike. 2-4 Hrs ride + pushing/walking on rocks and I love this shoes. It was on a great deal. Used to have NB for last 2 years which were perfect as well. Green colour is very very nice .and different.

customer_reviews.title: Avoid these as they have issues.
customer_reviews.text: These are OK when first being worn but after 7 mile run they will destroy your feet, something in the way these are made is fundamentally wrong so avoid. I have had such a bad experience with Salomon over this I will never use again.

product_meta.title: SALOMON Men's Sense Link Running Shoes
feature_bullets: SENSIFIT - Sensifit system works to cradle the foot providing a precise and secure fit.
Non marking CONTAGRIP - Delivering optimal traction on varied surfaces, Salomon's Contagrip outsoles use the ideal combination of specialized rubbers for each specific use
ORTHOLITE - OrthoLite sockliner combines a specific Ortholite foam and an EVA heel cup.
Ortholite foam - Creates a cooler, drier, healthier, better cushioned environment under the foot, It will not break down or lose effectiveness over time.
EVA heel cups - Allows for a better heel support and added cushioning.
